data.title: The Society of Authors
data.text:
English PEN and the Society of Authors are hosting an evening with author, historian and biographer Antonia Fraser, in celebration of her 90th birthday.

Antonia Fraser will appear in conversation with the Guardian’s Claire Armitstead to discuss her life and work, including her experiences in literary London, her multiple award-winning works, her marriage to playwright Harold Pinter and her huge support of authors and author organisations.

The event – ‘An Appreciation of Antonia Fraser at 90’ – will take place at The British Library on Wednesday 21 September at 7pm. The evening will include an opportunity for audience questions and close with a drinks reception.

Antonia Fraser is the author of many widely acclaimed historical works, which have been international bestsellers. She was awarded the Medlicott Medal by the Historical Association in 2000 and was made a DBE in 2011 for services to literature.

Commenting on the event, Antonia Fraser says:

“I’m delighted to be joining the Society of Authors and English PEN at The British Library for an evening in conversation with Claire Armitstead to discuss my experiences as an author and of supporting fellow authors. I look forward to celebrating my 90th birthday with you all.”

Tickets are now open to the public for £10.00 or free to British library members.

Find out more about the event and how to book on our events page.
